4. Documentation: are you using a reference manager such as Zotoro (www.zotero.org/) or annotation software e.g. NVivo (https://admin.kuleuven.be/icts/english/research/software/Nvivo/nvivo)? Many reference managers use the Dublin Core standard. If you like to learn more about these tools you can always request a meeting via rdm@kuleuven.be.
5, 6. Storage, preservation: Why don't you use KU Leuven storage solutions that are more secure and free for you to use, onedrive and the archive server for example, for more information see https://admin.kuleuven.be/icts/services/onedrive and https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en. 
7. Sharing: KU Leuven now also has a data repository that you can use to share your data: www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr
label: good with suggestions
